description: Thrift (Armeria pseudarmeria 'Dream Weaver') is an amazing plant species that is native to the Northern Hemisphere. Its evergreen clumps form a lush cushion of bright green foliage that stays evergreen in winter. Its beautiful bell-shaped pink flowers bloom late in the season and create lovely dabs of color amongst the clumps of foliage. These flowers are pollinated by bees and butterflies, making them a great addition to any pollinator garden. The 'Dream Weaver' variety of Armeria pseudarmeria has an especially distinctive flower form with a unique combination of pink and cream hues. It's hardy and long-lived, so it will provide you with years of interest and charm. It's adaptable to most soils and prefers full sun, making it a great choice for small spaces, rock gardens, and borders. Thift is a wonderful choice for gardeners who are looking for attractive, low-maintenance plants.
